titles: Armour of proof, or a soveraign antidote, against the contagion of evil company Together with the skill, will, and industry of lewd ones; in tempting to sin, and drawing to perdition. Being subjects of concernment for the younger sort. The second part. By R. Younge of Roxwel in Essex, Florilegus.
author: Younge, Richard.
publisher: printed by J.M. for James Crump, in Little Bartholomews Well-yard,
notes: Reproduction of original in: New College (University of Edinburgh). Library.
